item.description:
Dongshuai Li is a Postdoctoral Researcher at DTU Space, currently she is the Principle Investigator(PI) of DFF Sapere Aude Project Studying Lightning Processes with Neuromorphic Imaging on Microsecond Time Scales(NEURO-Lightning)

Dongshuai received her PhD degree from Nanjing University of Information Science & Technology (NUIST), China in 2016.

  • From Oct. 2014 to Sep. 2015, she worked as a research assistant with Dr. Farhad Rachidi and Dr. Marcos Rubinstein at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne(EPFL) - EMC Lab.

  • From Jan. 2018 to Dec. 2021, she joined the Instituto Astrofísica Andalucía - Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas(IAA-CSIC) as a Postdoctoral Researcher in Granada where she was supervised by Dr. Alejandro Luque, working at the ERC Project Lightning propagation and high-energy emissions within coupled multi-model simulations.

  • In 2022, she moved to Denmark at Technical University of Denmark (DTU) - DTU Space to work with Dr. Tosten Neubert and Dr. Olivier Chanrion as a Postdoctoral Researcher on the Danmarks Frie Forskningsfond(DFF) Project Investigation of Blue Corona Discharges at the Top of Thunderclouds.

  • In Nov. 2023, she got the DFF Sapere Aude Project Studying Lightning Processes with Neuromorphic Imaging on Microsecond Time Scales(NEURO-Lightning), where since then she can focused on study inner plasma physics of lightning by using neuromorphic imaging technique.

Her main research contributions cover a wide range of topics related to Atmospheric Science, Lightning Physics and Computational Electromagnetics and etc.

During her free time, she likes traveling, hiking, camping and kayaking.
